intro: Schismatoglottis rejangica, commonly known as the Rejang arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, making it a member of the orchid family, though it is not typically classified as a true orchid. The plant is characterized by its broad, arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or white in color. Schismatoglottis rejangica is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage, though it requires a humid, warm environment to thrive.
